snippet: The doctor smuggled himself into Homs, Syria, in February and operated on 89 people before the government’s relentless assault forced him to leave.
abstract: Experiences of Jacques Beres, French doctor who smuggled himself into Homs, Syria, to tend the wounded and sick, offer a rare glimpse at the medical emergency that has developed as the Syrian conflict rages on.
lead_paragraph: The doctor smuggled himself into Homs, Syria, in February and operated on 89 people before the government’s relentless assault forced him to leave.

headline.seo: French Surgeon, Jacques Bérès, Recalls Slipping Into Syria Last Month
headline.main: French Surgeon, 71, Saves Lives in Syria
headline.print_headline: French Surgeon, 71, Saves Lives in Syria

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
